prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing a book inventory:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "BookID": ["B001", "B002", "B003", "B004", "B005"],
    "Title": ["The Great Gatsby", "To Kill a Mockingbird", "1984", "Pride and Prejudice", "The Hobbit"],
    "Author": ["F. Scott Fitzgerald", "Harper Lee", "George Orwell", "Jane Austen", "J.R.R. Tolkien"],
    "Genre": ["Classic", "Classic", "Dystopian", "Romance", "Fantasy"],
    "Stock": [12, 8, 15, 7, 20],
    "Price": [10.99, 9.50, 12.00, 8.75, 15.25]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Print the "Title" of the book with the highest "Price". 2) Print the total number of books currently in "Stock". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, identify the most expensive book by title, and calculate the total stock.
